metadata.title: CVE-2020-11934 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
It was discovered that snapctl user-open allowed altering the$XDG_DATA_DIRS environment variable when calling the system xdg-open.OpenURL() in usersession/userd/launcher.go would alter $XDG_DATA_DIRS toappend a path to a directory controlled by the calling snap. A malicioussnap could exploit this to bypass intended access restrictions to controlhow the host system xdg-open script opens the URL and, for example, executea script shipped with the snap without confinement. This issue did notaffect Ubuntu Core systems. Fixed in snapd versions 2.45.1ubuntu0.2,2.45.1+18.04.2 and 2.45.1+20.04.2.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-11934` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

snap-confine - 2.45.1+18.04.2
snapd - 2.45.1+18.04.2
snapd-xdg-open - 2.45.1+18.04.2
ubuntu-core-launcher - 2.45.1+18.04.2
ubuntu-core-snapd-units - 2.45.1+18.04.2
ubuntu-snappy - 2.45.1+18.04.2
ubuntu-snappy-cli - 2.45.1+18.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: snapd package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.45.1+18.04.2').
